questions.question: When he tore his confession, Proctor decided

choices.answer: to escape Salem with his family.
to serve a life term in prison
to lecture to the court
to let the court hang him.

questions.question: How did Abigail and the other girls convince Danforth that Mary was a witch?

choices.answer: They held a mirror in front of Mary
They presented Mary's diary to the court
They threw water onto Mary's clothes
They began to repeat everything Mary said.

questions.question: Before the trials began, Hale told Tituba that she had been chosen

choices.answer: to bring fame to Salem
to help cleanse the village
to help teach the people
to bring power to the Devil.

questions.question: When Elizabeth was asked whether or not her husband was a lecher,

choices.answer: she fainted on the floor
she refused to speak at all
she admitted that he was
she replied that he was not

questions.question: Abigail said that Goody Proctor had discharged her from service because

choices.answer: Abigail had accidentally dropped a teapot.
Abigail would not be Goody Proctor's slave
the Proctors' boys did not like Abigail.
Goody Proctor did not like Abigail's cooking

questions.question: The Putnam's claimed it was a sign of witchcraft in the Parris house when Betty

choices.answer: lost her eyesight for nearly two full weeks
screamed while a Psalm was sung
refused to eat anything but uncooked meat
discovered she could no longer read the Bible

questions.question: Mrs. Putnam claimed that Betty Parris

choices.answer: had been known to speak German
had been seen flying like a bird
had stolen the Putnams' candlestick
had fought with her schoolteacher.

questions.question: When Danforth questioned the truth of her claims against some of the villagers, Abigail

choices.answer: asked if she could speak with a lawyer
pretended not to hear Danforth's question.
broke down and started sobbing loudly
warned Danforth to beware for his own soul.

questions.question: Hale said the Devil had probably chosen to come to the Parris house because

choices.answer: the Devil could sense that Betty was weak
Parris had been wanting to prove himself
the Devil wanted to win the best of souls
Proctor had sent the Devil to kill Parris

questions.question: After Proctor was accused of being a witch, Hale

choices.answer: praised God that the truth had been found.
denounced the court proceedings and left
suggested that Proctor be shot immediately
offered to act as the judge in Proctor's trial.

questions.question: Danforth expressed shock when he was told that

choices.answer: Proctor was a wealthy man
Proctor had studied for the ministry
Proctor gambled on Sundays
Proctor plowed on Sundays

questions.question: Hale asked Proctor _____ as proof of Proctor's Christian character.

choices.answer: to recite the Commandments
to give up his belongings
to walk on hot stones
to summon the Lord to him

questions.question: Proctor informed the court that Abigail and the other girls

choices.answer: danced naked in the woods
stole candles from the church
played games in the cemetery
charged money for telling fortunes

questions.question: Walcott accused Martha Corey of being a witch because

choices.answer: he said he felt a chill whenever she came near him
he had lost three oak trees to disease that year
he swore he had heard her chanting spells one night
he had been unable to keep any of his pigs alive.

questions.question: Betty said that Abigail _____ in hopes of killing Goody Proctor

choices.answer: had drunk a charm made with blood
had set a trap in the Proctors' barn
had drawn a skull on the Proctors' door
had recited a prayer to the Devil

questions.question: Giles Corey died when

choices.answer: Tituba fed him poisonous herbs one evening
a wolf attacked him while he was hunting
huge stones were placed upon his chest
a lynch mob hanged him from a tree

questions.question: As Proctor handed Mary's deposition to Danforth, Hale suggested that

choices.answer: Mary should be given a chance to apologize
Proctor should let a lawyer present the claim
the villagers should be thoroughly questioned
the girls should be sent to a mental hospital.

questions.question: When Cheever produced a warrant for Elizabeth's arrest, Proctor

choices.answer: grabbed the warrant and ripped it
sent Elizabeth to stay with a friend
agreed that Elizabeth should be questioned
asked his lawyer to look at the warrant.

questions.question: This play was written by

choices.answer: Bernard Shaw
William Inge
Arthur Miller
Clifford Odets

questions.question: Mrs. Putnam believed that Tituba

choices.answer: could talk to the dead
could alter the future
could read people's minds
could change the past.

questions.question: Giles Corey complained that he could not say his prayers one night because

choices.answer: he kept hearing voices inside his head
his wife was reading a strange book
he couldn't remember any prayers.
someone was looking through his window

questions.question: Proctor said that he did not often come to church because

choices.answer: Parris rarely mentioned God in his preachings
Parris demanded too much money for the church
his children were too young to bring to church
his wife had been afraid of seeing Abigail there

questions.question: Danforth stated that in cases dealing with witchcraft, the court had to

choices.answer: find evidence against the accused
rely solely on the claims of the victims
expect to find very few witches
give the accused every chance to explain.

questions.question: Danforth had received a claim in which Elizabeth

choices.answer: threatened to kill Abigail
stated that she was pregnant
admitted that she was a witch
accused Parris of corruption

questions.question: After Proctor confessed to the court, he

choices.answer: would not demonstrate any of his evil powers.
would not name any other guilty persons.
wanted his wife to be brought to his jail cell
wanted a chance to redeem himself to God

questions.question: Why had Rebecca Nurse been charged with practicing witchcraft?

choices.answer: It was said she had murdered Mrs. Putnam's babies
It was believed she had killed Marshal Herrick.
It was believed she had set fire to the meeting house
It was said she had spit upon the Bible at church.

questions.question: Cheever believed he had evidence against Elizabeth when he discovered

choices.answer: a strange figure carved on her front door
a basket filled with gold and silver coins
an herb potion brewing on her kitchen stove
a poppet with a needle stuck in its belly

questions.question: After Mary had accused her of lying, Abigail

choices.answer: claimed that Mary had been insane for years
begged Mary to join her in carrying out the Devil's work
pretended that Mary had changed into a bird
threatened to tell Mary's parents that she was pregnant.

questions.question: When he began to fear that the people of Salem might riot against the court, Parris

choices.answer: asked that the court place a guard near his home
began to carry a gun with him wherever he went
acked his belongings and moved to another village
recommended that the hangings be postponed

questions.question: Giles Corey believed that Putnam wanted George Jacobs accused of witchery because

choices.answer: Jacobs had once insulted Putnam's wife
Putnam wanted to be appointed judge
Putnam wanted to buy Jacobs' property
Jacobs had tried to ruin Putnam's business
